availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: George W. Jolly (Breckinridge County, Kentucky, and Hancock County, Kentucky, deputy circuit clerk)

body.p: Breckinridge County, Kentucky, and Hancock County, Kentucky, deputy circuit clerk. Stephensport, Kentucky, native. Son of John B. Jolly and Rachael Hardin Jolly. Educated under the Rev. R. G. Gardiner in Hardinsburg, Kentucky. Studied law with Judge Kincheloe in Hardinsburg and Judge G. W. Williams in Hawesville. Deputy clerk of the Breckinridge Circuit Court in 1861. Deputy clerk of the Hancock Circuit Court in 1863.

bibl.p: Biographical Cyclopeida of the Commonwealth of Kentucky (Chicago: John M. Gresham Company, 1896), p. 309-10. Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Breckinridge County, District 1, p. 146. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Breckinridge County, Hardinsburg, p. 503. Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Breckinridge County, Hardinsburg, p. 15. KYR-0001-020-1544. KYR-0001-029-0564.
